meanings.sent1: He phonied his report by copying his friend's work.
meanings.sent2: She was caught phonied her signature on the document.
meanings.sent3: The magician phonied the disappearance of the coin trick.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist phonied his identity to gain trust.
meanings.sent5: The student phonied his excuse for not completing the assignment.

meanings.sent1: The con artist phonied the old lady into giving him money.
meanings.sent2: She tried to phonied her way out of trouble by lying.
meanings.sent3: The prankster phonied his friend into thinking it was his birthday.
meanings.sent4: The fox phonied the rabbit into coming out of its burrow.
meanings.sent5: The salesman phonied his pitch to make the product seem better than it was.

meanings.sent1: The phonied painting was quickly identified as a fake.
meanings.sent2: She wore a phonied smile to hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The phonied designer bag fooled many people at first glance.
meanings.sent4: His phonied apology did not convince anyone of his sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The phonied antique vase turned out to be a cheap replica.
